name: MSF Mental Health - mhGAP Baseline v2

questions.label: mhGAP forms are to be filled only by mhGAP clinician (Clinical officer / GP / nurse trained in mhGAP / psychiatrist)
Why is the patient coming to you
Presenting history / evolution of symptoms
questions.questionInfo: Current symptoms, onset, duration, course, intensity, triggers, associated symptoms.

questions.label: Past psychiatric history
questions.questionInfo: Past diagnoses, past substance use, number of episodes, duration, treatment, side-effects.

questions.label: Does the patient have a current suicidal risk?
questions.questionInfo: ask the patient: 'Do you think about killing yourself?' If 'no' then mark 'no risk'

questions.label: Patient medical / surgical history (incl. current medications and dosage)
questions.questionInfo: Check also in 'Conditions' and 'Medications' and update them there if necessary.

questions.label: Medication and dosage - Please check in 'Medications' (update it if necessary)
Patient already on psychotropic/psychiatric medication (not prescribed by MSF)?
Additional information about previous treatment (including side effects)
Allergies / Contra-indications
questions.questionInfo: Check also in 'Allergies' and update it there if necessary.

questions.label: Enter in 'Vitals' today's measurements for 'weight', 'blood pressure' and 'heart rate'
value: Enter in 'Vitals' today's measurements for 'weight', 'blood pressure' and 'heart rate'

questions.label: Basic mental status examination
questions.questionInfo: Appearance, orientation/attention, mood/affect, speech, thought content/process, perception - e.g., hallucinations, illusions- judgment, insight.

questions.label: Did you have problems performing daily activities, such as cooking, bathing, or chores outside the household?
Did you have problems getting along with family or friends?
Did you have any problems sleeping, such as sleeping too much or not enough?
Have you been bothered by unpleasant thoughts, worries or ideas?
Have you felt sad or nervous?
In general, in the past week, how well has the child been feeling?
Did the child have problems playing, doing chores, homework or other day to day activities?
Did the child have problems getting along with others?
Did the child have problems paying attention, understanding or remembering things?
Did the child have problems with his appetite, such as having too little or too much hunger?
Did the child have problem sleeping, such as sleeping too much or not enough?
Did the child complain about pain or discomfort with his/her body?
Did the child seek comfort and closeness from someone?
Did the child wet the bed?
Was the child sad or irritable?
Was the child worried or scared?
In general, how helpful were the therapeutic or counselling sessions FOR YOUR CHILD?
In general, how helpful were the therapeutic or counselling sessions FOR YOU?
MHOS score

questions.questionInfo: Sum of all points from answers above

sections.label: PHQ9 - Over the last two weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

questions.label: Little interest or pleasure in doing things?

answers.label: More than half the days (2 points)
More than half the days (2 points)

questions.label: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much?

answers.label: More than half the days (2 points)

questions.label: Feeling tired or having little energy?

answers.label: More than half the days (2 points)
More than half the days (2 points)

questions.label: Feeling bad about yourself - or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down?

answers.label: More than half the days (2 points)

questions.label: Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television?

answers.label: More than half the days (2 points)

questions.label: Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or the opposite - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual?

answers.label: More than half the days (2 points)

questions.label: Thoughts that you would be better off dead, or of hurting yourself in some way?

answers.label: More than half the days (2 points)

questions.label: PHQ-9 score

calculate.calculateExpression: (littleInterestOrPleasureInDoingThings === 'b631d160-8d40-4cf7-92cd-67f628c889e8' ? 1 : littleInterestOrPleasureInDoingThings === '234259ec-5368-4488-8482-4f261cc76714' ? 2 : littleInterestOrPleasureInDoingThings === '8ff1f85c-4f04-4f5b-936a-5aa9320cb66e' ? 3 : 0) + (feelingDownDepressedOrHopeless === 'b631d160-8d40-4cf7-92cd-67f628c889e8' ? 1 : feelingDownDepressedOrHopeless === '234259ec-5368-4488-8482-4f261cc76714' ? questions.questionInfo: Sum of all points from answers above

questions.label: If you checked off any problems, how difficult have these problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people?
Depression severity scale

answers.label: PHQ9 score 10-14: Mild depression or chronic depression (symptoms lasting for more than two years)

questions.questionInfo: A patient is considered as having signs of depression if: The answer to at least one of the first two questions is 'more than half the time' AND the question about difficulty at home, work and going along with others is answered at least 'somewhat difficult'. Consider referral to mhGAP clinician/ psychiatrist if major/severe depression.

sections.label: GAD7 - Over the last two weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

questions.label: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge

answers.label: More than half the days (2 points)

questions.label: Not being able to stop or control worrying

answers.label: More than half the days (2 points)

questions.label: Worrying too much about different things

answers.label: More than half the days (2 points)
More than half the days (2 points)

questions.label: Being so restless that it is hard to sit still

answers.label: More than half the days (2 points)
More than half the days (2 points)

questions.label: Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen

answers.label: More than half the days (2 points)

questions.label: GAD7 score

calculate.calculateExpression: (feelingNervousAnxiousOrOnEdge === 'b631d160-8d40-4cf7-92cd-67f628c889e8' ? 1 : feelingNervousAnxiousOrOnEdge === '234259ec-5368-4488-8482-4f261cc76714' ? 2 : feelingNervousAnxiousOrOnEdge === '8ff1f85c-4f04-4f5b-936a-5aa9320cb66e' ? 3 : 0) + (notBeingAbleToStopOrControlWorrying === 'b631d160-8d40-4cf7-92cd-67f628c889e8' ? 1 : notBeingAbleToStopOrControlWorrying === '234259ec-5368-4488-8482-4f261cc76714' ? 2 :  notBeingAbleToStopOrControlWorrying==='8ff1f85c-4f04-4f5b-936a-5aa9320cb66e' ? 3 : 0) + (worryingTooMuchAboutDifferentThings === 'b631d160-8d40-4cf7-92cd-67f628c889e8' ? 1 : worryingTooMuchAboutDifferentThings === '234259ec-5368-4488-8482-4f261cc76714' ? 2 : worryingTooMuchAboutDifferentThings === '8ff1f85c-4f04-4f5b-936a-5aa9320cb66e' ? 3 : 0) + (troubleRelaxing === 'b631d160-8d40-4cf7-92cd-67f628c889e8' ? 1 : troubleRelaxing === '234259ec-5368-4488-8482-4f261cc76714' ? 2 : troubleRelaxing === '8ff1f85c-4f04-4f5b-936a-5aa9320cb66e' ? 3 : 0) + (beingSoRestlessThatItIsHardToSitStill === 'b631d160-8d40-4cf7-92cd-67f628c889e8' ? 1 : beingSoRestlessThatItIsHardToSitStill === '234259ec-5368-4488-8482-4f261cc76714' ? 2 : beingSoRestlessThatItIsHardToSitStill === '8ff1f85c-4f04-4f5b-936a-5aa9320cb66e' ? 3 : 0) + (becomingEasilyAnnoyedOrIrritable === 'b631d160-8d40-4cf7-92cd-67f628c889e8' ? 1 : becomingEasilyAnnoyedOrIrritable === '234259ec-5368-4488-8482-4f261cc76714' ? 2 : becomingEasilyAnnoyedOrIrritable === '8ff1f85c-4f04-4f5b-936a-5aa9320cb66e' ? 3 : 0) + (feelingAfraidAsIfSomethingAwfulMightHappen === 'b631d160-8d40-4cf7-92cd-67f628c889e8' ? 1 : feelingAfraidAsIfSomethingAwfulMightHappen === '234259ec-5368-4488-8482-4f261cc76714' ? 2 : feelingAfraidAsIfSomethingAwfulMightHappen === '8ff1f85c-4f04-4f5b-936a-5aa9320cb66e' ? 3 : 0)

questions.questionInfo: Sum of all points from answers above: 0-4 Minimal Anxiety / 5-9 Mild Anxiety / 10-14 Moderate Anxiety / >14 Severe Anxiety

questions.label: CGI-S (rating of severity CGI-S: how mentally ill is the patient at this time?)
questions.questionInfo: If the patient’s  score ≥ 5, consider referral  to mhGAP clinician / psychiatrist

questions.label: Main diagnosis

answers.label: Childhood behavioral disorder (incl. ADHD, conduct disorder)

questions.questionInfo: Clinical diagnosis (only by a psychologist, psychiatrist or GP trained in MH)

answers.label: Childhood behavioral disorder (incl. ADHD, conduct disorder)

questions.label: Medications and side effects were explained to the patient / caregiver?
The patient / care giver understands the side effects?
The patient consented to proceed with pharmacological treatment?
Follow-up session required?
questions.questionInfo: Follow up session required? (If no, fill the Exit form)

calculate.calculateExpression: Autofill with the first date of mhGAP visit after the current form’s date
